So we know next we must next check the doctor's credentials.
Do we just ask the doctor?
Let's read the text and find out.
Now let's talk about the second most important thing to do when finding a doctor.
Finding a doctor is hard, I'm not sure what the next step is.
_user_, please help Jordan.
The office environment is important to check out before choosing a doctor.
Why is that?
Let's read and find out!
Okay, we have checked the doctor's credentials. What do we do next?
Excellent question! Let's look at the text and find out.
We are talking about importance in this passage. However, first we must identify the topic of the text?
The topic tells us what we are talking about!
Jordan, that is correct.
Now we have identified the most important step to finding a doctor: interviewing the doctor. Why is it the most important step?
I'm not sure.
_user_, can you help Jordan?
What actions do we take to find a doctor?
Well, Jordan there are several steps to finding a good doctor. Let's talk about the most important step first!
There is a lot of information on the schedule. Let's look at the reasons the schedule may include certain information.
The bus schedule is not always the same.
Why is it not always the same?
Sometimes events or holidays can cause changes.

Ok, i feel like i am starting to get the hang of this bus schedule thing. However, i'm still confused about something. Sometimes i get on a bus and it stops a bunch of times. Then i get worried i am not on the right bus. Shouldn't the bus go directly to my stop?

Jordan, sometimes buses stop more than once. It's important to know if a bus stops more than once. That way you will not get worried because you will know the bus is supposed to stop before it reaches where you want to go.
Oh ok. That makes sense. But how do we find out if a bus stops more than once?
The schedule shows if a bus stops multiple times or not. Let's practice by looking at information about the Raines line.
I'm still a bit unclear on this multiple stop issue. How can i tell how many stops a bus will take along its route?
Jordan, good question.
Let's move on to the least important thing to do. When I say least, that doesn't mean it is, not, important. It means that the other things we discussed are, more, important.
Oh that makes sense. I was going to ask you about that. Your mind reading skills are excellent, Cristina.
Let's move on to the question.
_user_ and Jordan, welcome back.
Hello again everyone. I'm so glad i made it for the lesson. I almost missed the bus and nearly didn't get here in time. I have a hard time understanding when my bus is coming and where it is going.

Jordan, then you will really find this lesson useful. Today, we are going to be learning about the order of events and order of importance. A bus schedule is a perfect example of a text that requires the reader to know about time and order of events.
Great. _user_, i hope you can help me with this lesson.
Let's go ahead and get started. Start by reading this first text. When you are finished, press on the continue button at the bottom. Go ahead and start.
You both did a great job on this last text. Now we are going to move on to another text.
Alright! I'm pretty confident! Bring it on!
Read this text, when you are finished reading, press on the continue button at the bottom of the page.
Jordan, are you going anywhere else tomorrow?
Actually, yes. Here is another place i need to go tomorrow: The industrial district.
Ok, well it looks like the poplar line goes to the industrial district.
I need to be there before eight. When does the poplar line arrive in the industrial district?
Jordan, where to next?
I want to take my dogs to the park soon. However, I do not know what bus goes to the park.
Let's look at the schedule and find out.
Jordan, this is the bus schedule you use to get around town. Let's practice understanding this schedule.
Excellent. This will really be useful, especially because i need to get to main street tomorrow by 11:00 am. Can you two help? Is there a bus that will get me there on time?
Item.speech: Excellent. This will really be useful, especially because i need to get to main street tomorrow by 11 A. M. Can you two help? Is there a bus that will get me there on time?

Item.text: Let's look at the schedule and find out!

_user_, Here is another situation and I will ask you what to do about it. There is a woman named Maxine. She is being sexually harassed by a man named Larry at her work. He has been making very suggestive comments and making inappropriate advances toward her. The other day he followed her to her car and threatened her.
What a creep!
She talked to human resources but all they said was to ignore it. Maxine feels very threatened by his behavior. What should she do?
I think she should punch him in the face.
That's not an appropriate action.
The order of importance often changes.
It does not stay the same?
Jordan, no, it does not stay the same. Let's look at the text and find out why it changes.
The next situation is a tough one. Someone is having a problem with sexual harassment at work and the supervisor is involved.
Oh no! What do we do?
Let's read the text and find out what we should do.
These are very difficult.
Yes, these types of situations can be difficult to handle. Let's continue to read the text and find out what to do if a conflict of interest exists.
Let's talk about the topic of this text.
The topic is what to do when things happen at work, right?
Jordan, yes. Let's dig right into the text. We'll start by looking at the first thing the text tells us to do when having a problem with general conduct.
Pat keeps stealing my friend, Frank's, lunches. Frank has asked Pat to stop, but he still does it.
Poor Frank.What does the text say Frank should do about Pat stealing his lunches?
I think my supervisor is stealing money. I am not sure what to do.
Jordan, that's a terrible situation. Let's consult the test to see what you should do.
It appears your supervisor is up to no good. There is evidence that he is committing fraud. Who do you speak to about this problem?
I do not know. I need help.
_user_, please help Jordan.
There are certain times when you should speak to the department head first. When should you report a problem to the department head? Let's look at the text and find out.
Both of you did very well today! We got through some pretty tough passages!
Yeah we did. But I feel pretty good about it. We were really successful. And i think i will be able to figure out which bus to take at what time.

Remember, in this lesson, both order of events and order of importance are not always cut and dry. Circumstance can have a big impact on how we summarize. Also, signal words are great clues to tip you off to important information. Great job today, again. I will see you two next time.
Yeah, see everyone later!
I have another question. Why is the text on the first line darker than the other text? The words like name, departure, arrival and so on are a different style than the other text.
Jordan, the words in first row are darker or bolder than other words to indicate important information. They have a special name.

So now we are going to talk about summaries. A summary for a schedule is a tricky thing because technically the whole text is summarized, however there are summaries in this text that can be picked out.
But how do we know what to put in a summary for a text like this?

Good question! A summary would include information based on where you are going. A complete summary would include other information as well, but we can find the outline of summaries already in the text.
Look at the summary provided, there appears to be information in the text that is not needed,
Finding the irrelevant information is difficult. I need help.
Jordan, don't worry, we will help you.
Talking to the receptionist can have its benefits. Look at the text to find out why you may want to talk to the receptionist.
Let's talk about why talking to the receptionist is the least important thing to do. Read the text to find out!
Summaries that do not include all important information or include irrelevant information are bad summaries.
So now we are going to talk about summaries. A summary of this order of importance text includes all of the important things the text includes but does not include unnecessary details.

Question.text: It looks like the main line will get you to main street tomorrow but i am not sure if it will get you there in time. _user_, can you help us? press on the time the main line will arrive at main street.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The main line will reach main street at ten twenty five in the morning. We know this by looking at the arrival time column and the main line row. Jordan, if you take the main line to main street, you will get there before 11.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it gets there at nine.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I think it gets there at ten twenty five.

Question.text: _user_, what do we call the words that are in the top row and contain important information?

Answer.text: They are called headings in the text. Headings briefly describe the information below it. Headings are important in schedules.

Question.text: _user_, Is this a good text summary?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: No, this is not a good text summary. A good text summary includes only the most important information and leaves out the less important details.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt

Answer.name: Correct

Question.text: _user_, What is the first thing you do if you suspect your supervisor has committed fraud and you are uncomfortable talking to the audit department?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is talk to your department head. Though the text says to contact your supervisor or department head if you are uncomfortable with the audit department, your supervisor is the person you suspect of fraud. So you would want to talk to your department head in this case.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt
Answer.text: _user_ this is another tough one. Who should you talk to if you suspect your supervisor is committing fraud?

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Remember, if you don't press an answer, I don't know what your answer is!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, what do you do?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think you talk to your supervisor about it.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I think you talk to your department head.

Question.text: _user_, in which of the following situations should you first go to your department head?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is, conflict of interest. This one is tricky because the instructions for reporting fraud also mention going to your department head. However, the instructions say talk to your department head about the fraud if you think your supervisor is involved. We can infer, then, that the department head is only approached first if you think your supervisor is involved in the fraud. In a conflict of interest, however, you always contact the department head first

Answer.text: let's take a look through all of the areas of conduct. Which one lists the department head as the first person to contact?

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Please press on an answer, even if you're not sure.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it's the first one.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I think it's the third one.

Answer.text: Frank has already tried to talk to his co-worker. What is the next step he should take?

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Don't forget to press an answer.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, what should frank do?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think he should talk to Pat. Talking about lunch is making me hungry.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I think he should talk to his supervisor.

Question.text: _user_, What do I do if I think my supervisor is stealing money?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: You should talk to your company audit department. Under the heading of fraud, part A talks about general cases of fraud. However, stealing is financial fraud and so we need to look at part B for direction. Part B says you should report financial fraud to the audit department.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt
Answer.text: _user_ this is a tough situation. What should Jordan do if he thinks his supervisor is stealing money?

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: press an answer, even if you're not sure.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, read the text, what does the text say you should do?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I should talk to my department head.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I think i should talk to the audit department.

Question.text: _user_, What should Maxine do now?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Maxine should report the situation to the police. Since human resources did not help her, she should go to the next step which is contacting the police.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt
Answer.text: let's think about Maxine's options. She has already talked to Human Resources and feels like they did not help. What should she do now?

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: _user_ Please press an answer.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, what do you think Maxine should do?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: She should punch him!

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: She should report the situation to the police.

Question.text: _user_ is the order of importance the same for every situation?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The order of importance is based on circumstance. Certain types of behavior or conduct may be handled in different ways. For instance, fraud and sexual harassment are different issues and so are not handled the same way.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt
Answer.text: please try again. In every area of conduct, do you have the same order of importance for how to report it?

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Don't forget to press on an answer!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, is the order of importance always the same.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I bet its always the same.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: No. I think it's based on the circumstance.

Rule.name: DoneReading1
Rule.description: First passage finished. Next page. To PageLoaded

Rule.name: LoadPageMedium
Rule.description: Medium page is loaded. To Read

Rule.name: GetTutoringPackMedium
Rule.description: Get medium tutoring pack. To HasTutoringPack

Rule.name: HasItem
Rule.description: Show item. Check agent. To AskQ

Rule.name: JordanAskQ
Rule.description: Jordan asks main question (not implemented in media and tutoring packs). To UserAnswer

Rule.name: CristinaAskQ
Rule.description: Cristina asks main question. to UserAnswer

Rule.name: CorrectJordanAgrees
Rule.description: User correct. JordanAgree. Feedback. To GoBack

Rule.name: CorrectJordanDisagrees
Rule.description: User correct. Jordan incorrect. Feedback. To GoBack
